title: Droven short sword
data:
- - *For the weapon in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") and [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), see [Dark elven short sword (SLASH'EM)](/wiki/Dark_elven_short_sword_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Dark elven short sword (SLASH'EM)").*
  - *For the weapon in [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), see [Dark elven short sword (EvilHack)](/wiki/Dark_elven_short_sword_\(EvilHack\) "Dark elven short sword (EvilHack)").*

| )                |                                                         |
| ---------------- | ------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name             | droven short sword                                      |
| Appearance       | short sword                                             |
| Damage vs. small | 1d8                                                     |
| Damage vs. large | 1d8                                                     |
| To-hit bonus     | +0                                                      |
| Weapon skill     | [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword")          |
| Size             | [one-handed](/wiki/One-handed "One-handed")             |
| Base price       | 10 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid") (+10/positive enchant) |
| Weight           | [15](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                             |
| Material         | [obsidian](/wiki/Obsidian "Obsidian")                   |

A **droven short sword** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") and [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack"). It is a one-handed weapon that uses the [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword") [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill"). It has a [default material](/wiki/Object_materials_\(dNetHack\) "Object materials (dNetHack)") of [obsidian](/wiki/Obsidian "Obsidian"), and appears as a "short sword" with its material displayed when [unidentified](/wiki/Identification "Identification").

[Lolth's Fang](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#Lolth.27s_Fang "DNetHack artifacts") is an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") droven short sword.

## Generation

Droven short swords are not randomly generated. [Drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\)#dNetHack "Drow (starting race)") [heroes](/wiki/Hero "Hero") start with knowledge of the droven short sword, and drow in roles that start with short swords or [spears](/wiki/Spear "Spear") will instead receive droven short swords.

Several [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(monster_attribute\) "Drow (monster attribute)") can be [generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") droven short swords:

- [Hedrow wizards](/wiki/Hedrow_wizard "Hedrow wizard") and [hedrow master-wizards](/wiki/Hedrow_master-wizard "Hedrow master-wizard") always generate with a droven short sword.
- [Houseless drow](/index.php?title=Houseless_drow\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Houseless drow (page does not exist)") have a 1⁄6 chance of generating with a droven short sword.
- [Y-cultist fighters](/index.php?title=Y-cultist_fighter\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Y-cultist fighter (page does not exist)") always generate with a droven short sword, and may receive another droven short sword in one of their weapon kits: there is a 2⁄3 chance for the first kit to have one and a 1⁄4 chance for the third kit to have one, while the second kit always includes another droven short sword.
- [Y-cultist wizards](/index.php?title=Y-cultist_wizard\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Y-cultist wizard (page does not exist)") always generate with two separate droven short swords, and the first has a 1⁄20 chance of being [sickness](/wiki/Sickness "Sickness")-poisoned.
- [Y-cultist matrons](/index.php?title=Y-cultist_matron\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Y-cultist matron (page does not exist)"), [drow matrons](/wiki/Drow_matron "Drow matron"), [drow matron-mothers](/wiki/Drow_matron-mother "Drow matron-mother"), and [yochlol](/wiki/Yochlol "Yochlol") generated in unearthly drow have a 19⁄20 chance of generating with a droven short sword.
- [Driders](/wiki/Drider_\(dNetHack\) "Drider (dNetHack)") have a 3⁄5 chance of generating with a droven short sword.
- The [Avatar of Lolth](/wiki/Avatar_of_Lolth "Avatar of Lolth") generates with four blessed [acrid](/wiki/Acrid "Acrid") +2 droven short swords and 2 blessed acrid +4 droven short swords among her many weapons.
- Other drow that are capable of [two-weapon combat](/wiki/Two-weapon_combat "Two-weapon combat") and lack defined starting inventories will always generate with a droven short sword.

* *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Droven_short_sword\&action=edit)*

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Droven short sword

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
For the weapon in SLASH'EM, SpliceHack and SlashTHEM, see Dark elven short sword (SLASH'EM).
For the weapon in EvilHack, see Dark elven short sword (EvilHack).
)  
Name droven short sword
Appearance short sword
Damage vs. small 1d8
Damage vs. large 1d8
To-hit bonus +0
Weapon skill short sword
Size one-handed
Base price 10 zm
(+10/positive
enchant)
Weight 15
Material obsidian

A droven short sword is a type of weapon that appears in dNetHack, notdNetHack and notnotdNetHack. It is a one-handed weapon that uses the short sword skill. It has a default material of obsidian, and appears as a "short sword" with its material displayed when unidentified.

Lolth's Fang is an artifact droven short sword.

Generation

Droven short swords are not randomly generated. Drow heroes start with knowledge of the droven short sword, and drow in roles that start with short swords or spears will instead receive droven short swords.

Several drow can be generated with droven short swords:

  • Hedrow wizards and hedrow master-wizards always generate with a droven short sword.
  • Houseless drow have a 1⁄6 chance of generating with a droven short sword.
  • Y-cultist fighters always generate with a droven short sword, and may receive another droven short sword in one of their weapon kits: there is a 2⁄3 chance for the first kit to have one and a 1⁄4 chance for the third kit to have one, while the second kit always includes another droven short sword.
  • Y-cultist wizards always generate with two separate droven short swords, and the first has a 1⁄20 chance of being sickness-poisoned.
  • Y-cultist matrons, drow matrons, drow matron-mothers, and yochlol generated in unearthly drow have a 19⁄20 chance of generating with a droven short sword.
  • Driders have a 3⁄5 chance of generating with a droven short sword.
  • The Avatar of Lolth generates with four blessed acrid +2 droven short swords and 2 blessed acrid +4 droven short swords among her many weapons.
  • Other drow that are capable of two-weapon combat and lack defined starting inventories will always generate with a droven short sword.
This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

A '''droven short sword''' is a type of [[weapon]] that appears in [[dNetHack]], [[notdNetHack]] and [[notnotdNetHack]]. It is a one-handed weapon that uses the [[short sword]] [[skill]]. It has a [[Object materials (dNetHack)|default material]] of [[obsidian]], and appears as a "short sword" with its material displayed when [[Identification|unidentified]].

[[dNetHack artifacts#Lolth's Fang|Lolth's Fang]] is an [[artifact]] droven short sword.

==Generation==
Droven short swords are not randomly generated. [[Drow (starting race)#dNetHack|Drow]] [[hero]]es start with knowledge of the droven short sword, and drow in roles that start with short swords or [[spear]]s will instead receive droven short swords.

Several [[Drow (monster attribute)|drow]] can be [[Monster starting inventory|generated with]] droven short swords:

* [[Hedrow wizard]]s and [[hedrow master-wizard]]s always generate with a droven short sword.
* [[Houseless drow]] have a {{frac|6}} chance of generating with a droven short sword.
* [[Y-cultist fighter]]s always generate with a droven short sword, and may receive another droven short sword in one of their weapon kits: there is a {{frac|2|3}} chance for the first kit to have one and a {{frac|4}} chance for the third kit to have one, while the second kit always includes another droven short sword.
* [[Y-cultist wizard]]s always generate with two separate droven short swords, and the first has a {{frac|20}} chance of being [[sickness]]-poisoned.
* [[Y-cultist matron]]s, [[drow matron]]s, [[drow matron-mother]]s, and [[yochlol]] generated in unearthly drow have a {{frac|19|20}} chance of generating with a droven short sword.
* [[Drider (dNetHack)|Driders]] have a {{frac|3|5}} chance of generating with a droven short sword.
* The [[Avatar of Lolth]] generates with four blessed [[acrid]] +2 droven short swords and 2 blessed acrid +4 droven short swords among her many weapons.
* Other drow that are capable of [[two-weapon combat]] and lack defined starting inventories will always generate with a droven short sword.
